snippet.title: Abraham Lincoln and the Movies
snippet.description:
* Abraham Lincoln and the Movies
Melvyn Stokes
Comparatively little work has been done on how Abraham Lincoln has been represented in American cinema. Yet movies have been a major – and during the first half of the twentieth century probably the major – influence on how his memory has been constructed in American popular culture. This article analyzes changing representations of Lincoln on screen, showing that differing cinematic constructions ...
Journal: American Nineteenth Century History , vol. 12, no. 2, pp. 203-231, 2011
